stanza.line: Not from the stars do I my judgement (a)pluck(/a)
But not to tell of good or evil (a)luck(/a)
Of plagues of dearths or seasons' (b)quality(/b)
Nor can I fortune to brief minutes (c)tell(/c)
Pointing to each his thunder rain and (d)wind(/d)
Or say with princes if it shall go (c)well(/c)
By oft predict that I in heaven (d)find(/d)
But from thine eyes my knowledge I (e)derive(/e)
And constant stars in them I read such (f)art(/f)
As truth and beauty shall together (e)thrive(/e)
If from thy self to store thou wouldst (f)convert(/f)
Or else of thee this I (g)prognosticate(/g)
Thy end is truth's and beauty's doom and (g)date(/g)
